results.title: Beneficial effect of simvastatin and pravastatin treatment on adverse cardiac remodelling and glomeruli loss in spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: Beneficial effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ treatment on adverse @DISEASE_Ventricular_Remodeling @DISEASE_MESH:D020257 @@@cardiac remodelling@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Tooth_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016388 @@@glomeruli loss@@@ in spontaneously @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Bezerra DG, Mandarim-de-Lacerda CA. Beneficial effect of simvastatin and pravastatin treatment on adverse cardiac remodelling and glomeruli loss in spontaneously hypertensive rats. Clin Sci (Lond). 2005 Apr;108(4):349-55. PMID: 15610072

results.title: Simvastatin upregulates Bcl-2 expression and protects retinal neurons from early ischemia/reperfusion injury in the rat retina.
results.text_hl: Our results suggest that @<m>DISEASE_Tooth_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016388 @@@RGC loss@@@ induced by @DISEASE_Retinitis @DISEASE_MESH:D012173 @@@retinal@@@ @DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@IR@@@ may be prevented by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and that the mechanism underlying this process possibly involves an alteration in the apoptotic pathway.

citations.NLM: Ko ML, Chen CF, Peng PH, Peng YH. Simvastatin upregulates Bcl-2 expression and protects retinal neurons from early ischemia/reperfusion injury in the rat retina. Exp Eye Res. 2011 Nov;93(5):580-5. PMID: 21777583
citations.BibTeX: @article{21777583, title={Simvastatin upregulates Bcl-2 expression and protects retinal neurons from early ischemia/reperfusion injury in the rat retina.}, author={Ko ML and Chen CF and Peng PH and Peng YH}, journal={Exp Eye Res}, volume={93}, number={5}, pages={580-5}}

results.title: Use of an adult rat retinal explant model for screening of potential retinal ganglion cell neuroprotective therapies.
results.text_hl: The ability to replicate previously reported in vivo RGC neuroprotection in retinal explants was verified by demonstrating that caspase inhibition, @GENE_BDNF @GENE_24225 @@@brain-derived neurotrophic factor@@@ treatment, and stem cell transplantation all reduced RGCL cell @<m>DISEASE_Tooth_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016388 @@@loss@@@ in this model. Further screening of potential neuroprotective pharmacologic agents demonstrated that @CHEMICAL_Betaxolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015784 @@@betaxolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@, @CHEMICAL_tafluprost @CHEMICAL_MESH:C485333 @@@tafluprost@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ all alleviated RGCL cell @<m>DISEASE_Tooth_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016388 @@@loss@@@ in retinal explants, supporting previous reports.

citations.NLM: Bull ND, Johnson TV, Welsapar G, DeKorver NW, Tomarev SI, Martin KR. Use of an adult rat retinal explant model for screening of potential retinal ganglion cell neuroprotective therapies. Invest Ophthalmol Vis Sci. 2011 May 17;52(6):3309-20. PMID: 21345987
